website_summaries.verdict: A basic model with limited functions and an exceptional warranty.
pros: Infrared illuminator produces extremely bright images
Rugged build, yet lightweight and convenient to carry
cons: Images are well-lit but a bit grainy
Lacks some of the features of competitors, such as video recording

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE READ
customer_reviews.text: Not a one star bc the seller was bad, I received this product fast and no issues with the box or contents. This product however, is cheaply made, I attempted to do the lifetime warranty sightmark form, however, they wouldn’t accept it bc amazon isn’t considered and authorized dealer. The reason I contacted them in the first place is bc my product had a manufacture defect(which is common for this version). My optic would turn on but never off and the IR did not work. Long story short stay away from sightmark products
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J Alderete

customer_reviews.title: Good Budget NODs
customer_reviews.text: I used PVS 7s and 14s in the Army. These NODs, for the price are a good value. You will have to play with the mounting setup if your putting on a helmet, and will have to adjust the pitch/angle the J-arm is at, but a decent eye relief setting can be found. I did not flip the mounting bracket.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: NVG Ready
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, up to several hundred yards with an additional IR hand held light. You must adjust the focus to the distance you want to work with. You can read your watch or look at deer two hundred meters away. Used for hog hunting and range time at night. Love the 2x, better than the 1x.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Robertson

customer_reviews.title: A toy
customer_reviews.text: This thing isn’t even useful as a toy. I wanted to call it user error, but there are only two buttons and the the lens focus. Pretty sure I can figure those out. Without IR I see nothing (cloudless night). With IR I can see objects at about 10 meters, but I only get an image of an area about 10’ wide at that distance and it appears so small as to be all but useless. I threw away the box too soon, otherwise I would return.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bundy

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun and Great Price
customer_reviews.text: For the price I am very pleased! I have used the Gen2 PVS-7 in the past and they are good, so I was a bit skeptical that a $170 nv scope would be useful. I am able to read a book, move through the house, and interact easily with objects. It’s small enough to comfortably hold, and super easy to operate. Some reviews have stated that the visibility is extremely poor. I thought this too at first until I realized there are two focal points. You can focus both the piece closest to your eye and the piece furthest from your eye. After reading the instructions it made so much difference.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Stands the test of time
customer_reviews.text: I bought two different models in 2015, the SightMark and Yukon, (pictured). The site mark has held up with limited use, picture/tube are fine, case is excellent, Unlike the Yukon...look closely, plastic housing has degraded and become sticky and yuck! STAY WITH SIGHTMARK!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: its gen one, dont expect video game quality
customer_reviews.text: these are honestly awesome for the price, it has a mounting spot to put it on a helmet or tripod. note you may need to flip the little plastic piece around but its pretty easy to do. IMPORTANT do not expect video game quality out of these, if you have never used real night vision your prolly gonna have some pretty unrealistic expectations, the field of view is low and you need to adjust it to get a clear picture. however for 200 bucks, you're prolly not gonna find a better product
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: DON'T!!!!! Wish I could return this cracker jack toy.
customer_reviews.text: Worst Gen 1 ever by a factor of 10. side by side the fire field makes this seem like a toy for 3 year olds. It doesn't lock into the mount rail...still wobbles no matter how tight it is. focus rings soooooo lose you constantly have to refocus both sides. even with added Illuminator its resolution at 30 yards begins to get unusable, where the fire field with some illuminator can positively I'd a fox vs raccoon at 150 yards---side by side comparison. Finally, once mounted behind EOTEC holographic its COMPLETELY unuseable, so not even close quarters capable
customer_reviews.author: William P. Beard

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is
customer_reviews.text: Solid NVG for the price. Decent picture quality, not bad on batteries and fun. This isn't anything that it claims to be. This is a Gen 1 $200ish device that simply allows you to see better at night. If you are looking for pro nods head elsewhere. If you want to have some fun in the dark give these a look.
customer_reviews.author: Dtwn92

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. Takes a little Getting used to the small bright eyepiece and images. I was hesitant to purchase this sight due to the negative reviews, finally purchased anyway. I am happy with the initial use, toying around with it. Needs a little fine tuning as you try to view images, however focuses easily and clearly by turning the rings on the eyepieces. For the money and the amount of time my sight will be used, I am pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN LOUKIDES

customer_reviews.title: It's Gen 1
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I expect for Gen 1 night vision. If you're expecting what you see in movies then you need to research a little more before you buy it. If that's what you are looking for then you need at least Gen 2. These are pretty good if you live in town, or if you use a IR Illuminator with them. Out in a rural setting you won't see much unless the moon is bright. But for kids to play around with they are fun little gadgets.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: These things are garbage. Terrible focus. Anything more than 10 feet away is just a blurry blob. Also the eye piece was warped out of shape out of the box. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: andrew kasper

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Ok for the money this is a great entry level night vision. The field of view is small but it works perfect. Glass is clear with not many defects. You can see clearly out to 30 yards but you can see aprox out to 100 yards with separate ir light. This is obviously not a military grade unit so dont expect that. If you just want something to play with i highly recommend it. Behind a ir ready optic on a fire arms it works perfect , also with a ir laser i have found no issue. The monocular/rifle scope are the same unit minus the mounting bracket.
customer_reviews.author: Tkssomtme

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Does not focus or improve your vision at night. Takes great pictures in the day time with the cap on as shown by users that have given this more than one star.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Everything I expected. Works as described and for the refurbished/used like new price of $144, I could not be happier. Will use it to see what is creeping up on my backyard in the woods at night now, typically deer, but I suspect sometimes people wander across my property too.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Great gen 1 night vision
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good. You are getting what you pay for. Don't expect a perfect $1000+ military quality. Also, you can see the red from the IR if you look at it from at least 30 feet away. Will be testing this weekend to see exactly how far someone can spot you if they are looking at you using it.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: for the price good, but if your serious about your night vision
customer_reviews.text: for the price good , but if your serious about your night vision , gonna have to pay more
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sightmark Customer Service is excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have the 2x24 Ghost Hunter. It works great, I’d buy it again based on the quality of the product. It’s not my only Sightmark product though. I had an issue and had to contact Sightmark customer service. I will continue buying their products because of the excellent customer service backing up the quality products they sell.
customer_reviews.author: Odey

customer_reviews.title: not so much without it but most gen 1 stuff is like that.
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for a year and it's still going strong! Works very well with the illuminator, not so much without it but most gen 1 stuff is like that.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Wiggington

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed night vision for Gen 1. The IR light is slightly visible when on but you have to be looking for it. All in all I’d order again. Downside is the head mount does not come with it nor can you buy it separate from sight mark. However there are similar versions available if you look hard enough.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Wright

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at the high quality product on a gen 1 ...
customer_reviews.text: Surprised at the high quality product on a gen 1 night vision monocular. The image is surprisingly clear and without the blemish or small specks that might exist. The power source of two AA batteries will be much cheaper to operate than the expensive lithium batteries used by many night vision devices. This also has a long battery life, unlike its digital cousins. Advertised as being made in China, but the label on mine says made in Russia. Initially very hard to focus using just the diopter, but then discovered the front lens could be adjusted after sliding back a large plastic ring.
customer_reviews.author: timchi

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Total overpriced junk. Poor image quality, poor eye relief. Feels cheap and fragile. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: T.J.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty cool! Let's me see in the dark as it says. Haven't gotten to test it's range yet but indoors and looking out of a window is good. Focusing it for a clear image is tricky though.
customer_reviews.author: GTWR60000

customer_reviews.title: Great 1st gen night vision!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical ordering an open box item but was pleased when it came in the original box and all paperwork came with it! The scope itself is pretty good it's my first Foret into night vision so this gen 1 nv is awesome to me. Co witneses with my sightmark ultras hot mess spec reflex perfect allowing me to use it on my rifle. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Speed&Angels

customer_reviews.title: a good Gen 1 NVG
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to hang on my FAST helmet for Air-soft. It has a clear view and I suggest to buy another IR illuminater to expend its view range. I have not really used it because of the bad J arm. I am going to buy new one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: I was OverCharged by $50.00 or $199.00 instead of $149.00. My total Charge$226..00
customer_reviews.text: I returned one Night Vision Monocular for a better quality one for which I was OverCharged by $50.00 or $199.00 for the returned one, instead of $149.00. My total Charge for the new one was $226..00 for the new one for which I am happy with, much better Night Vision Quality. By the way, it is Impossible to send an e-mail to Amazon with this Issue. I hope I will get a response and proper Credit for $50.00. Thank you, Onnik Hovanessi
customer_reviews.author: Onnik Hovanesian

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a week.
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay for a few days. It functioned as a super cheap NVG. You get what you pay for. A week later I tried it out again and it’s totally shot. Doesn’t work at all. Amazon would not allow me to return, so now I’m stuck with almost a $200 paper weight. I would spend a few bucks more and get something nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Jarred

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for the price. It’s not on the level of equipment that I’ve used in the Army however it does give you great value
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok, might upgrade later
customer_reviews.text: For a budget NVG it’s good for the price. One thing I did notice is that actual IR lights don’t show up though, might be my surefire helmet light or it’s the nvg. Further testing will be conducted.
customer_reviews.author: Justin A.

customer_reviews.title: Good night vision for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for the price. I can say that the sightmark gen 1 night vision is better than expected. I have a gen 1 night vision monocular from night owl and this one is by far the better one. I would recommend this especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: crmj2002

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: As many reviews state, you get what you pay for. The night vision is terrible it would be better to use your eyes unaided after they adjust to the dark. If you plan on running IR the entire time you wear the night vision it’s not too bad. Minus the red light that will be constantly glowing, and or IR shining for other NVG users to see. Overall save your money and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan D.

customer_reviews.title: Very good for $$
customer_reviews.text: Mine works great in no light, for being a 1st gen NVG I didn't expect it to look like I was in a lit room, that'd just be silly. Unit powers on and off quickly, torch illuminates well and is less visable than some of of my buddies units. The manual focus is a pain, but what do you expect from a sub $1000 unit?
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Good Gen 1
customer_reviews.text: Need a replacement screw mount. Don't know how to get threads are plastic and are stripped
customer_reviews.author: Brenton brady

customer_reviews.title: Missing the head mount
customer_reviews.text: Only giving it two stars because it did not come with the head mount.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Ernst

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So great. It lines up perfectly with my red dot. I can see 150 or so yards clearly.
customer_reviews.author: david denny

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Gen 1 monocular
customer_reviews.text: It works. It’s a gen 1 night vision monocular for $200. What do you expect? Focus is terrible, grain is bad, but it mounts to a helmet and it was cheap. If you want good NVGs, expect to pay $6k+ for gen 2 and $12k+ for gen 3.
customer_reviews.author: vincent mayville

customer_reviews.title: Prefect budget option
customer_reviews.text: This hands down is great for the price, I got it for $192 total and it works perfectly, it is a gen 1 though so don't expect it to work like a mid range gen 3 or anything but hands down if you're on a tight budget this thing works perfectly and I can't wait for my helmet and rhino mount to come because I already have the j mount needed to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah

customer_reviews.title: Good For the Money
customer_reviews.text: If you just want some night vision to assist in camping or goofing around, then this is the product for you. It doesn't work in pitch black (without activating the IR light). Its range of view is limited. But it will work perfectly if you need to read a map or take a walk on a trail at night.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great I still love it
customer_reviews.text: Work well for the price I got a better ir light Update I been using the a lot on 6.8 rifle it still going strong
customer_reviews.author: Edward R

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t recommend any body buy it
customer_reviews.text: Product is not worth the money I spent real poor Quality real blurry can’t even focus really really really bad
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Quintanilla

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Mounted the unit to my helmet. Works well enough for my purposes. Looking forward to using later in the Fall.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S.

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Great for price... picture quality a little grainy. Constantly re focusing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest quality really pretty hard to make out much of ...
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest quality really pretty hard to make out much of anything and you have to focus it to see every different option you’re looking at.. but it does provide night vision
customer_reviews.author: Sam C.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible blurry sights with no focus
customer_reviews.text: Not worth it even a little it has absolutely no focus. pointless.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: It works. Not gonna be able to run around in the dark very well, but you can definitely sit and watch from concealment fairly well.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun A

customer_reviews.title: BOX OPEN, PARTS MISSING.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the product booklet says it comes with a mount for your headlamp band - NOPE, not in the box. Second, you say batteries are included - NOPE, not in the box. In fact the box had been opened previously, and I suspect, returned. Kind of perturbed that you all obviously don't check,
customer_reviews.author: Michele Ann Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Threads Strip Easy
customer_reviews.text: Great Infared Goggles, but the plastic threads stripped with the recommended J arm
customer_reviews.author: roger malin

customer_reviews.title: Get em
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for the money. Sight Mark has great customer support.
customer_reviews.author: nathan lozano

customer_reviews.title: For the price, very good
customer_reviews.text: Very nice gen 1 NVG for the money, would recommend if on budget
customer_reviews.author: Justin Farlow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: For the price you will be amazed at the quality and performance.
customer_reviews.author: gengelbrecht

customer_reviews.title: Good IR goggles
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it to see IR Laser Sight from my IRL light. It works. I installed the light and this monocular on my gun. Excellent. Very happy. Good seller. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: LYHONGTHAI

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for in the house other than that don’t bother
customer_reviews.author: silverbullet1029

customer_reviews.title: Good for low-res device
customer_reviews.text: My first night-vision device so not sure what to expect. Seems to 'light up' the subject well, not too detailed but good enough for viewing.
customer_reviews.author: John Wharton

customer_reviews.title: Ehhhh
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. It shocks the hell out of me when I turn it on. Can only see about 40 yards. I wouldn’t suggest this product to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... but as far as seeing everything else not so good not to mention I needed the sightmark illuminator to ...
customer_reviews.text: I was able to see eyes and bodies at about 45 to 75 yards but hard to make everything else out soo did the trick but as far as seeing everything else not so good not to mention I needed the sightmark illuminator to work that far
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive.
customer_reviews.text: A lot more than I expected. Illuminates the night very brightly. When the Infared turned off, you can still see acceptable. But when you engage the IF mode, the night vision scopes really shows its true colors. Don't face the apocalypse and food riots without this.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: works for me
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work ok for my purposes,, can't say anything about battery life until I have had it awhile
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to use this monocular, but it is difficult because of the effort to constantly focus it. It you are looking at a stationary item, it would be acceptable as long as the object is less than about 50 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: GReat little scope for the money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece for the money. I knew what i was buying when I ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: Gunslinger

customer_reviews.title: It's a good machine, but if you have bad vision gey ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good machine, but if you have bad vision gey the 1x version the 2x makes it difficult
customer_reviews.author: Suomi Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good night vision
customer_reviews.text: For the price it can't be beat. Long range and pretty good illumination. The biggest part of operation is just getting used to what you are seeing through the night optics. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Robert  Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: It's an awesome tool for me! I work night shift and it makes it easier to patrol low light areas in my most problem sections of town. I'm very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: tommy naylor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and great view for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome and great view for the price. The off switch kind of bothers me but for the price it is great quality.
customer_reviews.author: fdowd

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product if u have used good night vision before
customer_reviews.text: Not a good product if u have used good night vision before.
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: Took great care of it
customer_reviews.text: Didnt last one year. Took great care of it....and it died 3 months in. GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad low cost night vision device
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad low cost night vision device. Takes a little time to learn the proper method to focus, but overall, it did well when owl nest watching at maybe 30yds which is all I expected from it. The IR works well, but with any moon light to use, is not necessary. For Gen 1 at the price, I did not have big expectations and I would say this scope has met my expectations for ease of use, light weight and low cost.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick G. Timm

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this is awesome, cant wait to get in woods with it tho, only tested it out around me house
customer_reviews.author: locat

customer_reviews.title: not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: honestly, not bad for the price. it mounts to military nvg mounts but it will sit at a bit of an angle but not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: James tallakson

customer_reviews.title: seems durable (outdoor) and has an extremely bright IR illuminator spotter when used its pretty cool.
customer_reviews.text: outstanding quality for price , seems durable (outdoor) and has an extremely bright IR illuminator spotter when used its pretty cool .
customer_reviews.author: Dylen Greene

customer_reviews.title: Very good deal and nice image
customer_reviews.text: Very good deal and nice image.Works very well and is priced so most can afford it. I am happy to finally have 2 ,even my 4yr old is always trying to take them away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was really surprised with the quality of the night
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised with the quality of the night vision
customer_reviews.author: Remy Decoster

customer_reviews.title: mounted behind a red dot scope and works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: exceeded expectations for a gen 1 scope. mounted behind a red dot scope and works like a champ
customer_reviews.author: John Goul

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good piece of kit. I've used it hunting and it really helps when predator hunting at night.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: Really exceeded my expectations for gen 1 equipment. I've used gen 3 in the military and this item is nowhere close, but is surprisingly very usable. Would highly recommend getting an ir flashlight to compliment this. The ir light included with this unit isn't great.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel H.

customer_reviews.title: Well...
customer_reviews.text: Just wasn't as clear as even a 1st Gen should be. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty dang cool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because we go camping all the time and it seems like there's always something lurking at the edge of the light of the campfire. I've only tested it out in my own yard thus far. But it works very well, and the image is good. You can focus fairly crisp, also the illuminator button really enhances the nightvision when it's most dark. Overall, seems like sturdily constructed, like it could take a few small bangs and still be fine. Comes with a carrying case and a terry cloth to clean the lens. Thus far, I am totally satisfied...
customer_reviews.author: dr. egg

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3000 dollar gen 4 nv device and got this for a friend. I gotta say it works much better than expected. If your inside 100 yards its perfect. The ir works well and batteries last a long time. Sure its not a military grade super deluxe model but for the price its well worth it.This thing cost less than the tax on nv device I feel like I should have just gotten this and a new truck.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: excellent product, built tough. great quality Works as described, I would recommend to anyone. Great for rifle scope or head gear
customer_reviews.author: JpL

customer_reviews.title: if I could of afforded $4k I would of bought the best, But it's better then not being able to ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a Gen 1 night vision, if I could of afforded $4k I would of bought the best, But it's better then not being able to see in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: T. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Surprising performance
customer_reviews.text: This Sight mark Ghost Hunter Night Vision monocular is everything it was supposed to be. I actually am very surprised how well it works given that its only a "Gen1" system. A good buy with lots of value.
customer_reviews.author: Rand C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: For the money it works very well. I mounted it on a airsoft m4 to run it through the mill and it worked perfectly. I did room searches and outdoor shooting both. Indoor the ir was a plus almost to bright. Outdoor in moonlight it was awesome! You do have a narrow field of view though and have to work with the focus. This was mounted behind a real eotech and worked perfectly. I'd say outdoors you have a good 75 yard range and maybe more depending on the moonlight. For the money well worth it. Compared to what it would cost for a gen3. More or less if things got ugly it would work for you
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: no more problems at night
customer_reviews.text: I had one from another maker this is great because it has the IR to help illuminate more. It back fires when objects like leaves are close to you or other obstructions like a tree or a fence but it has to be close, other than that one could see far and clear.
customer_reviews.author: David D

customer_reviews.title: ok but depends what you need it for
customer_reviews.text: did not work very good, could see somewhat in the dark but not was expected ended up returning. Trouble free return
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality night vision
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality night vision! I've seen kids toys that work better. Focus was very poor as well. Indicator light, that tells you the scope is on, shines right in your eye as go to look viewfinder.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID J. THORNE

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this
customer_reviews.text: If you are a serious hunter, please spend your money on a higher quality night vision device. This one was very disappointing. Low quality and very difficult to see through. I even tried fresh new batteries. Don't waste your time on this junk.
customer_reviews.author: DEWAYNE CRABB

customer_reviews.title: Grate buy .
customer_reviews.text: Grate buy but made my eye water with one leans reorder.
customer_reviews.author: ooooooooooooooooooooo

customer_reviews.title: Night Vision
customer_reviews.text: Tried the Sightmark Ghost Hunter 5x60 Night vision out the night we got it. Works great turns on quick vision at night is better than we thought. My wife and I are going to use it to see what is getting or chickens and ducks. My wife can't believe how clear she can see things through it. So far it is will worth it. I will recomend this product to everyone who is looking for night vision.
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: tony
customer_reviews.text: The product that I recived was in good condition and it meets my expectation, in the future I can count on your products
customer_reviews.author: beastlychi

customer_reviews.title: It's just not enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: I'm torn about this. It does what it's supposed to do. It takes surrounding light and lets you see things in the dark. But as one reviewer stated, it's like looking through a toilet paper tube. It just really isn't that fun or enjoyable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Jackson

customer_reviews.title: buck banging
customer_reviews.text: WAY BETTER THAN EXPECTED, caught these on sale for $120 and now knowing how great they are I would pay double if I had to.
customer_reviews.author: Locallaw81

customer_reviews.title: Look at the Price and it will not let you down!
customer_reviews.text: OK I'm in love! lol. I picked up this night vision Monocular for only $160! It's so clear and can make objects, people, animals and anything look as if I was watching them in the daytime again LOOK SO CLEAR! 10 out of 10.
customer_reviews.author: chris stewart

customer_reviews.title: which is still not very good. This is a great value though
customer_reviews.text: Performs the same as my $600 Gen 1 scope, which is still not very good. This is a great value though.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: They work great
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how well these would work, but on first use I was very impressed. Sure, these are not top of the line night vision, but for occasional novice use, entry level, etc, these are pretty darn good. Living in Alaska, not a lot of light during the winter, these allow me to see what critters may be lurking around.
customer_reviews.author: HFL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 18 year old son and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Duling

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work straight out of the box. In the ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work straight out of the box. In the middle of a move and unable to return for a new one or get my money back. SAD SAD
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: but great deal for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to be able to see a little further, but great deal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: sParker

customer_reviews.title: Close but still lacking
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice starter scope but is just lacking a little. I have used others for work (same gen) and the sight field is a little more extensive. Not too bad especially cause I got mine when it was on sale. If you can afford it look go with the upgrade its worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Fit4472

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Its okay. Save your money up just a little longer and go with a Gen 2.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm good w it ,.. have friends w p14's and its not bad ,.. will buy SM again
customer_reviews.author: DCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk !!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst product I have ever bought on amazon. I would not recommend it to anyone. It does not work at all . Do not purchase this scope. Too bad I missed the return window so now I am stuck with a very expensive paperweight. .
customer_reviews.author: steven

product_meta.title: Sightmark Ghost Hunter Night Vision Monocular
product_meta.description: Designed for vivid, long-distance imaging, the Sightmark Ghost Hunter 5x60 Night Vision Monocular features a lightweight, durable polymer construction for endurance, and a 60mm objective lens that captures any-size targets in low-ambient light conditions or total darkness. Equipped with a high-power infrared illuminator, the Ghost Hunter 4x50 Night Vision Monocular delivers a bright, clear image no matter how dark the conditions and a compact body style for easy travel. The automatic shut-off feature turns the unit off when exposed to bright light sources, saving the night vision tube and ensuring years of operation. This device is field tested and approved by the North American Hunting Club. Protected by a three-year warranty on the tube and Sightmark's Limited Lifetime Warranty on the housing, the Ghost Hunter 4x50 Night Vision Monocular is engineered to meet the highest requirements and standards of the serious night vision user.
feature_bullets: Ergonomic design and quick power up
